title: Meet The Melbourne Brand Making Fun + Non-Conventional Furniture
description: There’s a special place in our hearts for furniture that’s designed and made here in Australia, especially when it comes from a place of pure creativity. ESCULTURA is a new Melbourne-based brand founded by three designers who are all about having fun with furniture. The debut collection — made from compressed hemp, finished in lime and micro-cement — is bold, colourful, and a great reminder of what happens when you think outside the box!
author: The Design Files
excerpt: ESCULTURA is a new brand creating sustainable, made-to-order furniture that's fully customisable — and all made in Melbourne.
text: ESCULTURA is a modern furniture brand founded by three designers who are on a mission to do things a little bit differently. Kat Nitsou and Imogene Pond (of design studio Nitsou x Mo) and Maryke Bishop (whose family business Bishop Master Finishes specialises in bespoke Venetian plaster) come from different countries and careers, but were all brought together through their work in Melbourne’s design industry. ‘The concept of ESCULTURA really started from designing a custom dining table for our co-director Maryke Bishop who brought forward the use of micro-cement and lime,’ Kat says. What they came up with was a strong sculptural form, made from an innovative combination of sustainable materials that has since inspired the trio to create a full collection of playful furniture. It only felt right they call their brand ESCULTURA, the Spanish word for sculpture. Everything is handmade right here in Melbourne. First, furniture maker Moonpool uses low-VOC, carbon-negative compressed hemp to form a base, before each piece undergoes a meticulous hand-coating process using richly pigmented lime and micro-cement finishes from Bishop Master Finishes. ‘The result is furniture that is not only durable and luxurious, but also uniquely individual — no two pieces are ever the same,’ Maryke says. ‘They’re designed not only for the aesthetics of sculptural form and beauty in the hand-applied micro cement and lime, but with real integrity, built to withstand life’s messiness and the demands of wear and tear.’ Designed to be used both inside and outdoors, ESCULTURA’s range features bold dining tables, coffee tables, consoles, desks, plinths, and stools. The shapes are functional, yet full of personality, with a range of 30 bespoke colours to chose from. And since each piece is made to order, it’s also fully customisable, which means clients can flex their own creativity to have some fun reimagining the colour, size, and form to perfectly fit their space. ‘By manufacturing in Melbourne for the Australian market, we’re able to minimise the environmental impact associated with long-distance shipping and reduce emissions from imported goods. It also means we can work closely with our team to ensure a high level of quality,’ Imogene adds. What started as passion project, has now become a clever local business with its own showroom in Cremorne — open by appointment only. Explore ESCULTURA’s collections online here.

ESCULTURA is a modern furniture brand founded by three designers who are on a mission to do things a little bit differently.

Kat Nitsou and Imogene Pond (of design studio Nitsou x Mo) and Maryke Bishop (whose family business Bishop Master Finishes specialises in bespoke Venetian plaster) come from different countries and careers, but were all brought together through their work in Melbourne’s design industry.

‘The concept of ESCULTURA really started from designing a custom dining table for our co-director Maryke Bishop who brought forward the use of micro-cement and lime,’ Kat says.

What they came up with was a strong sculptural form, made from an innovative combination of sustainable materials that has since inspired the trio to create a full collection of playful furniture. It only felt right they call their brand ESCULTURA, the Spanish word for sculpture.

Everything is handmade right here in Melbourne. First, furniture maker Moonpool uses low-VOC, carbon-negative compressed hemp to form a base, before each piece undergoes a meticulous hand-coating process using richly pigmented lime and micro-cement finishes from Bishop Master Finishes.

‘The result is furniture that is not only durable and luxurious, but also uniquely individual — no two pieces are ever the same,’ Maryke says.

‘They’re designed not only for the aesthetics of sculptural form and beauty in the hand-applied micro cement and lime, but with real integrity, built to withstand life’s messiness and the demands of wear and tear.’

Designed to be used both inside and outdoors, ESCULTURA’s range features bold dining tables, coffee tables, consoles, desks, plinths, and stools.

The shapes are functional, yet full of personality, with a range of 30 bespoke colours to chose from. And since each piece is made to order, it’s also fully customisable, which means clients can flex their own creativity to have some fun reimagining the colour, size, and form to perfectly fit their space.

‘By manufacturing in Melbourne for the Australian market, we’re able to minimise the environmental impact associated with long-distance shipping and reduce emissions from imported goods. It also means we can work closely with our team to ensure a high level of quality,’ Imogene adds.

What started as passion project, has now become a clever local business with its own showroom in Cremorne — open by appointment only.
